Ghost Town

Basics

World

Tragedy

Ghost Towns of the World

Abandoned cities with a dark history. Ghost towns are the remainders of a town that has undergone a tragedy. It has lost its population to economic failure, natural disasters, human error, lawlessness and war. Around the world, they now act as tourist attractions or are simply untouchable.

Barkerville, British Columbia

Centralia, Pennsylvania

Craco, Italy

Deception Island, Antarctica

Epecuen, Argentina

Hashima Island, Japan

Kowloon Walled City, Hong Kong

Kolmanskop, Nambia

Oradour-sur-Glane, France

Pripyat, Ukraine

Tomioka, Fukushima

Wittenoom, Australia
